results.title: Mechanisation
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Michael Latham
results.brief_description: Uses animation and documentary footage to show that as well as specialisation, another way of creating more wealth with the same number of people is through mechanisation. Shows that mechanisation has two forms: (i) finding more energy and (ii) using the energy you already have more efficiently and productively.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Video Arts, Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Michael Latham

results.title: Mechanical Lifting Devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
This program shows that sound work practices can ensure the safety of of all those who come into contact with mechanical lifting devices.

results.title: Mechanical handling of traffic
results.creator_credit: Southern Region Film Unit and British Railways
results.brief_description: Mechanical aids to handling increasing amounts of goods and parcels leading to faster freight services on British Railways. Shows in some detail the various mechanical aids which speed up handling safety and efficiency in sheds, yards and stations.

results.title: Mechanical engineering
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Shows the many activities of the mechanical engineer in designing and constructing machinery of every kind. The student needs to be good at mathematics and science. Shows him involved in the study of technical drawing, principles of air conditioning, of refrigeration, internal combustion, jet engines and how they perform under various conditions.

results.title: Mechanical energy and thermal energy
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Norton Bloom
results.brief_description: Shows several models of both bulk motion and random motion of molecules; their interconnection as the energy of bulk motion. Demonstrates random motion and how it can average out to a smooth effect. Shows model of thermal conduction. Demonstrates a model using dry ice disc and small steel balls in which bulk mechanical energy of the disc is converted to ‘thermal’ energy of random motion of the balls. Explains the origin of the absolute temperature scale.
results.description: Shows several models of both bulk motion and random motion of molecules; their interconnection as the energy of bulk motion. Demonstrates random motion and how it can average out to a smooth effect. Shows model of thermal conduction. Demonstrates a model using dry ice disc and small steel balls in which bulk mechanical energy of the disc is converted to ‘thermal’ energy of random motion of the balls. Explains the origin of the absolute temperature scale.
description_for_label: Shows several models of both bulk motion and random motion of molecules; their interconnection as the energy of bulk motion. Demonstrates random motion and how it can average out to a smooth effect. Shows model of thermal conduction. Demonstrates a model using dry ice disc and small steel balls in which bulk mechanical energy of the disc is converted to ‘thermal’ energy of random motion of the balls. Explains the origin of the absolute temperature scale.

results.title: Mechanical energy
results.brief_description: Describes how mechanical energy exerts a force in solid, liquid and gas states and how we use these forces to do work. Explains potential and kinetic energy and how machines provide mechanical advantage.

results.title: Mechanical aptitudes
results.brief_description: Illustrates ways to test the mechanical interests and abilities of a student. A high school counsellor explains that the vocational field selected is not always entirely suited to the talents of the student. A student undergoes a series of test to find a course of study best suited to his interests, abilities and future plans. Different departments of training for a student interested in a given field are illustrated.

results.title: Mecca: the forbidden city
results.brief_description: The world’s 600 million Muslims are expected to make the pilgrimage to Mecca at least once in their lives. The film traces the ritual of the progress from Medina to Mecca, during which various rites are performed at the stopping places. A glimpse is given of the catering arrangements for 1,500,000 people, mostly men. The pilgrims enter the great Mosque where the sacred Ka’aba stands, centre of their devotions.
results.description: The world’s 600 million Muslims are expected to make the pilgrimage to Mecca at least once in their lives.
